name: Annam Leaf Turtle
description: It has a dark head with three or four yellow longitudinal stripes on the sides. The carapace is gray, the plastron yellow with dark spots.
spread_note: Southeast Asia – a small area in southeastern Vietnam
food_note: Small aquatic animals and aquatic plants
image_alt: Annam leaf turtle, photo: Tereza Mrhálková, Prague Zoo
reproduction: Females lay 3–6 eggs; incubation lasts 85–111 days.
attractions: It leads a secretive, mostly crepuscular lifestyle, spending days hidden under roots or among vegetation.
projects_note: One of the world’s most endangered turtles. For over 60 years, it was considered extinct in the wild, but a single turtle was recently discovered, suggesting a small population may still survive. The species’ survival depends on breeding in human care.
breeding: We have kept them since 1991, successfully breeding them repeatedly since 2005—a significant step toward ensuring the species’ survival, at least in assurance colonies.
